text: Frying the filling ingredients Dry roast the gram flour.  Dry roast the grated beetroot.  Add oil to the pan. Heat it. Add the grated ginger, cumin and asafoetida to the hot oil. Add the dry roasted beetroot, mint leaves, green chillies, salt, red chilli powder, garam masala and chaat masala too. Fry the ingredients over a low flame/low heat for 1 to 2 minutes. Do not forget to cover. Add the dry roasted gram flour. Mix in thoroughly. Add raisins. Mix to combine. Switch off the flame or remove from the heat.  Making the dough Mix the oil, salt and carom with the all purpose/plain flour to form a dough.  Knead the dough water.  Set it aside for 30 minutes.  Filling the kachoris Divide the dough into 8 equal parts.  Roll the eight pieces into balls. As you do so, include the filling made earlier inside the middle of each ball. Close the open part completely, then slightly press the ball down with your palm. Cooking the kachoris Add ghee to the cooking pan. Heat over a medium flame or on medium heat. Deep fry all kachoris. Keep the heat at medium level. Remove the fried kachoris once golden brown. If wished, drain the ghee on kitchen paper towel. Serve immediately. The beetroot kachori is now ready to serve. Serve with condiments such as minted yogurt (raita) or chutney.
